attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid courses more accessible regarding location and cost
attributes.background: Mental Health First Aid courses teach how to identify the signs of key mental health issues, provide initial help and capably guide someone towards suitable support. Despite its benefits, many people haven't heard of MHFA; the course is not affordable for all (£300 per person) and centres are scarce
attributes.additional_details:
Mental ill health costs companies £26 billion and affects 25% of people, while the annual cost to the NHS is predicted to double over the next 20 years from £105 billion. With fast diagnosis and application of viable treatment, this could be alleviated.
Our NCS Social Action project (government scheme run by Catch 22) aims to increase MHFA accessibility, thus enhancing mental health care and awareness, developing community support by removing stigmas and advancing knowledge.
www.mhfaengland.org

attributes.action: Immediate force to combat  suicides in Veterans and Members of our Armed Forces
attributes.background: More Veterans and serving men and women killed them selves in 2012 than were lost during the Afghan war.
attributes.additional_details:
The facts speak for them selves. The deaths are continuing to rise and the government and parliament must make the forming of this force a priority .More Falkland veterans have killed them selves than were actually killed  during the Conflict in 1982.
We demand an immediate force of Veterans and professional people  be made into a new force which will be given priority, to help and stop our veterans and serving forces killing them selves.

attributes.action: Allow baby's born after 18 weeks to be registered at birth.
attributes.background: My baby was born sleeping at 24+2 and his birth was registered. If I had him days earlier we wouldn't of had the right to have him registered. The law needs changing. I want every baby born from 18 weeks to be registered at birth and parents given a birth certificate.
attributes.additional_details: My baby was born sleeping at 24+2 and his birth was registered. He was classed as a BABY not a fetus. If I had my baby just 3 days before he wouldn't have been. He had a heartbeat that beat in me, He is a brother, and a son. We grieved, and we grieved hard! 3 days would not of made one single difference to what we went through. Every parent has the right to have there baby registered whether its 18 or 38 weeks. There baby was loved, there baby had a heart that beat, there baby was real. It's time the law changed! I want every baby born after 18 weeks to be registered and to have a birth certificate.

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: A better method and understanding when dealing with miscarriage and babyloss
attributes.background:
After experiencing a miscarriage 12 weeks I found the NHS aren't educated or given the right tools to deal with this. 

We need - 

More adequate information, compassion and understanding!
attributes.additional_details:
More adequate information - currently
In my local hospital is an a4 piece of paper. Any sort of leaflet or info pack to let you what is happening and what to expect.

More compassion - it's not a taboo subject and it isn't a something to be ashamed of. 1 in 4 people suffer so why do we feel ashamed? 

Men suffer too - my partner received a day off work for compassionate leave 

We need an all round more compassionate and sensible review of how the NHS deals with a family loosing a baby

attributes.action: Establish a Vetrans OAP hospital using Redford Barracks In Edinburgh
attributes.background: A lot of veteran pensioners within the North of England and the whole of Scotland do not see the Royal Hospital Chelsea as a viable option to retire to due to the distances involved for family and friends to visit and the feelings of isolation that this can cause.
attributes.additional_details: Would it not now be a good time with the announced closures of Redford Barracks in Edinburgh that one of the Barracks was gifted by the MOD for the Use of Veteran OAPs adopting the same lines and procedures as the Royal Hospital Chelsea but opened as a tri service arrangement so that old service personnel can retire to a home that meets not only their medical needs but also their needs of comradeship with the knowing that their families are within a short traveling distance for visiting

attributes.action:
Give Foster Carers employee rights. 
Why do they have to be self employed
attributes.background:
why is it Foster Carers Are forced to be self employed in  a highly regulated profession. Local Authorities and Independent fostering agencies can get away without offering their foster Carers employment rights. 
 Foster Carers can only work for one IFA or LA they are not independent contractors

attributes.action: Give horse riders more safe places to ride &  make it law to drive past at 15mph
attributes.background: Please give us more safe places to ride and take our horses that are free from the dangers of roads and also making it law for vehicles to pass at 15mph and make it part of driving tests so riders are safer.

attributes.action: Amend the proposed route of HS2, to follow the route of the A42 near to Measham.
attributes.background: The HS2 proposed route has been recently amended. Previously, it followed the existing course of the A42 dual carriageway to the north west of the villiage of Measham. The new proposal takes a route to the south east, passing through housing estates and recreational areas and walkways. Used by many.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/hs2-route-to-the-east-midlands-leeds-and-manchester-set-out-by-the-government

attributes.action: Change the law on child sex offences .
attributes.background: I would like to create a petition to change the law in sentencing on child sex offences. The sentencing should reflect the offence and be minimum life sentencing.

attributes.action: Introduce step-free access to all public houses and bars across the UK
attributes.background: As a disabled person who is a wheelchair user, I strive to live my life as closely as I can to that of an able-bodied person. However I often find when wanting to visit pubs and bars that poor access limits the opportunities available to me.
attributes.additional_details:
Throughout my travels I have find that very few pubs and bars as well as establishments generally have good access for disabled people. The vast majority will often have steps that a disabled person cannot overcome without some form of assistance.

Thus the law should be changed meaning that all pubs and bars must have step free access, in a similar manner to them being 'smoke free'. That would greatly improve the opportunities available to disabled people.

attributes.action: The Government should not support any company that leaves the UK post Brexit
attributes.background: I am calling on the Government to require; that all Government bodies and all Government agencies, do not enter into a contract with, or use the services of, any company that plans to move any part of their operation out of the UK, because of its exit from the European Union.
attributes.additional_details:
We want the people of the United Kingdom to unite in threatening to boycott, the services and products of any businesses, that plan to relocate out of the UK, post Brexit.
Did you know that companies including HSBC, EasyJet & Vodafone are considering moving their offices from the UK to Europe? This would risk 1,000's of UK jobs. Help us to put the GREAT back into Great Britain by boycotting these companies & any others that threaten to leave the UK. Show your support #Letstakebackthepower

attributes.action: Stop allowing the NHS to go into decline, put it back  in the public domain
attributes.background: Private companies are charging extortionate fees which are being paid for with public money.  Voters should be asked how they want their money to be to be spent or if they want to use their money to pay for high managerial positions which could pay for training for doctors and nurses.
attributes.additional_details: The speed at which the NHS is being placed into private hands is steadily increasing with more  contracts going to private providers, even when the NHS contracts  cost less for the same services. The money to pay those private companies comes from public money which should be going to the support of the NHS.  By placing the NHS completely in the public hands, Where we are given the ability to make decisions on what happens to our Health Service people would have more respect on how it is used.

attributes.action: Ensure all doctors, nurses and paramedics know how to treat adrenal crisis
attributes.background: I have Addison's and wear a medical alert bracelet. There has been several occasions where I have become very ill because of a delay in my treatment because staff did not have sufficient knowledge of Addison's and would not take my medical alert bracelet as confirmation of my illness/treatment.
attributes.additional_details:
Addison's occurs when the body can't produce enough steroid hormone. When illness/injury occurs in someone who is healthy they produce 10x the normal amount of cortisol. Someone with Addison's can't do this so an immediate dose of cortsol injection is necessary to avoid adrenal crisis. An adrenal crisis is a life threatening, medical emergency. 
So I ask that ALL medical professionals know what Addison's is and are trained how to treat someone presenting with suspected adrenal crisis.

attributes.action: Accept the BSA's offer of integrating lone refugee children into private schools
attributes.background:
"More than 220,000 have arrived in Europe this year, seeking safety and a better future. One in three is a child." - Unicef

In May 2016, the BSA (Boarding School's Association) offered the government more than 80 fully-funded places in private schools across Britain. They have been unfilled. Why?
attributes.additional_details: As poignant images and testimonies from refugees who have sacrificed everything to make the arduous journey become ever more common, many choose to avert their eyes in fear of the realisation that they could have done more. The British Government is among those who could do more - for a nation which has long prided itself on charity and helping those less fortunate, the paltry number is a farce. Urge them to collaborate with the BSA to restore this nation as one of the world's leading lights.

attributes.action: Drink drivers who kill must be charged  with 'Manslaughter'!
attributes.background: Wayne Moores was twenty eight. He was killed by a 'hit and run' drink driver, who was speeding and illegally undertaking another vehicle. He was left to die in the road.  His killer was charged with ‘Careless Driving whilst under the influence...’ and was out of prison within 3 years.
attributes.additional_details: Drink driving is never 'careless' it is must be considered automatically dangerous. Anything less is weak, offensive and insulting to the memory of those killed. It undervalues their lives by calling this crime a driving offence and is not proprtionate as the government states. Killing someone is not a 'driving offence', it is 'manslaughter'.

attributes.action: Repeal the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, used by the BBC to snoop
attributes.background: The BBC uses the Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000, passed by Tony Blair, to snoop on the public to maintain its enormous income and preserve its privileged position to control opinion in the UK, and prevent the public protesting in the only way it can against its biased reporting.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC has a charter to serve the public, and not its own elite. That BBC elite has used its monopoly position to influence the public in every election and has abandoned the original ethos of neutrality in providing information and news. If the public resent this then they should be able to vote with their wallets and the BBC should not be able to use the power of the state to oppress them fom exercising the free will that Englishmen thought was their birthright.

attributes.action: UK to offer free trade deals with any EU country that votes out in a referendum
attributes.background: With the EU starting to fall apart now is the time for the UK Government to offer the EU countries who are about to hold their own In/Out referendums the help and understanding they deserve by offering them a open trade deal with Great Britain if they vote for an exit.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition will have the effect of showing the world we are standing on our own two feet and ready to trade as normal with everybody who is free to trade with us, without the shackles of corrupt trade dictatorships.
It will also send a strong message to those silly billies who want a second referendum, a vote in parliament etc, and continue, in the face of our improving prospects to still continue to run down the UK in order to satisfy their own power aspirations and personal gain.

attributes.action: Stop a race to the bottom on corporation tax
attributes.background: The Conservative government has suggested that if we do not get sufficient access to the single market when the UK leaves the EU, the UK would be forced to lower corporate tax rates to attract business to Britain. This is not the future we want for our country.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that corporations should pay their fair share of tax to fund the infrastructure and public services we all depend on. We further believe that to achieve this, there must be cooperation between nation states on tax matters. 
 
We deplore any attempt to encourage tax competition and to foster a race to the bottom on corporate tax rates putting at risk the social investment that citizens rely on.
 
We call on the government to work cooperatively with our EU partners on harmonising corporate tax rates across Europe and to ensure that the main rate of UK corporation tax rate is returned to a minimum of 28%.

attributes.action: Do not make the British taxpayer pay for the renovation of Buckingham Palace!
attributes.background: Following recent news that Buckingham Palace is to undergo a £369 million renovation, it should not be at the expense of the British taxpayer. In a time of perennial austerity where hospitals, schools and the "JAM" (just about managing) families are struggling, surely this renovation is arbitrary?
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/nov/18/buckingham-palace-to-undergo-370m-refurbishment
http://www.thetimes.co.uk/_TP_/edition/news/mps-urge-royals-to-chip-in-for-palace-repairs-6htfxxqpm?ni-statuscode=acsaz-307
http://www.ibtimes.co.in/no-taxpayers-money-britains-citizens-want-queen-elizabeth-pay-370-million-palace-repairs-704963

attributes.action: Stop Making Tax Digital because it will be hugley burdensome on small businesses
attributes.background: HMRC is pushing ahead with Making Tax Digital: a scheme that will force all business to maintain digital accounts. Currently most small businesses use paper accounting records or spreadsheets. Small businesses lack the skills, time and funding to maintain digital accounts.
attributes.additional_details: Contrary to what HMRC have said, small businesses will not benefit from MTD. Making Tax Digital is a misnomer because businesses have been filing digital tax returns for 20 years. HMRC would gain from MTD because HMRC would receive more detailed trading information for businesses. Whilst HMRC needs to ensure it collects the correct tax, HMRC completely under estimates the cost of compliance on small businesses.

attributes.action: Allow women with step children to have fertility treatment on the nhs
attributes.background: My Husband has a 10 year old from a previous relationship. I have no children. We have been trying for a baby for 2 years and due to my husband having a child we are not entitled to full fertility tests or treatments on the nhs. I feel as though I am being punished for his past relationship failing.
attributes.additional_details:
We can only have base line testing this means just blood tests to check hormones and a scan to check for cysts etc and a sperm check we are not entitled to any other tests or actual treatment. I feel so alone and like no one will help me in this journey to be a Mum. Every month is devastating and feel so depressed each time we are unsuccessful.
If the reason I felt like this was because I had small breasts I would be entitled to bigger ones on the nhs. But I'm not entitled to help for a baby.

attributes.action: Tv advertisment to raise awareness on using country roads #ThinkCountryside.
attributes.background: There are a increasing number of incidents involving horses and cyclists on our country roads. A Tv advertisement will help raise awareness in educating communities on the dangers of blind bends. Detailed examples on How to pass horses and cyclists safely on the country roads.
attributes.additional_details: An Educational TV advertisement is the way forward in educating all road users to help reduce accidents and fatalities.

attributes.action: Stop trading & supporting India until it stops human rights violation in Kashmir
attributes.background: Draconian laws such as AFSPA & PSA are used by India to commit human rights violations in Kashmir with impunity, over last 44 days of worst curfew imposed in Kashmir, Indian forces have killed over 70+ civilians, 200+ blinded using pellets, including young kids as young as 1 year, injured 8000+.
attributes.additional_details:
Insha, 14 year old is battling for her life due to serious brain injury after been hit by pellets aimed deliberately at upper body.

Essentials supplies like food, water & medicine have been curtailed, communication restricted, an ambulance driver shot while transporting patient to hospital, Lecturer dragged from home and beaten to death. 

We people of Britain have an obligation to put an end to these human rights violations.

attributes.action: Due to its defence policy this house has no confidence in the government.
attributes.background:
The first duty of any government is the defence of the realm and its people.  The reports of the Commons Defence Select Committee and of Sir John Parker are ignored.
The Army Reserve is under strength.
In the UN we should be able to “Speak softly and carry a big stick”.
attributes.additional_details:
The Type 45's have not had their defects rectified. Our fleet is not able to defend our trade or undertake our world-wide duties. 
The army is  a militia.  Personnel have despicably been made redundant immediately qualifying for pension.  The RAF has too few A/C and no maritime reconnaissance capability.

attributes.action: Increase child maintenance service powers to investigate the self employed
attributes.background: Self employed people can hide earnings by dealing with cash in hand jobs and holding funds in their business accounts. By default the CMS won't investigate all associated accounts be it business or personal and often don't have the necessary powers to anyway to gather a true picture of income
attributes.additional_details: Children and full time carers are going without while irresponsible parents hide their true earnings. It should be illegal for individuals to do this and the CMS should have the powers and resource to do this from the offset for all self employed individuals. Full powers to look at recent and historic bank accounts, credit cards etc both personal and business in order to see a true account of earnings. Only then will the system be fair to struggling children and full time mothers and carers

attributes.action: Stop the M56 new junction 11a scheme.
attributes.background: Highways England are planning to introduce a M56 junction 11a. The plans squeeze a new junction between 2 existing junctions that are no more than 4 miles apart. No evidence has been offered by Highways England to justify it's need or cost. It would have a severe impact on several local communities.
attributes.additional_details: Having reviewed the existing plans many residents are sceptical about the motive for this junction. They believe that the new junction would only serve to channel traffic towards a new Mersey Toll Bridge crossing (currently under construction) and will do nothing to ease the serious congestion issues that already exist between Junction 12 and 14.

attributes.action: Do not bring in a fee/charge to use Recycling Centres nationwide
attributes.background: My local council and I am sure many will follow suit are planning to start charging for certain types of waste brought to the Recycling Centre. I would like the Government to stop this charge as I fear it will encourage fly tipping.

attributes.action: RAISE ISSUE OF PERSECUTION OF POLITICAL ACTIVISTS WITH MUGABE REGIME IN ZIMBABWE
attributes.background: We ask the UK govt to raise the issue of persecution of activists with the Zimbabwe govt. The last election was hugely rigged. Misgovernance & corruption have destroyed the economy resulting in starvation & 90% unemployment. Civil unrest is growing & protesters refused bail & jailed without trial.
attributes.additional_details: Linda Masarira, locked up since 6 July on trumped-up charges, has health problems & is the mother of 5 children (youngest 2 yrs). Accused of inciting riots in the female section of Chikurubi prison on 10/9, she was moved to solitary confinement in the dangerous male section – we fear for her safety. Other activists are also still incarcerated, many needing medical care after violent treatment by the police. Both Gift Siziba’s hands are believed to be broken.  This vicious persecution must stop.

attributes.action: Allow the Help to Buy ISA bonus to be used for deposits for first-time buyers.
attributes.background:
The Help to Buy ISA was set up by the government to help first-time buyers. However the money the government puts in cannot be used as part of the deposit.

As the scheme is supposed to help first-time buyers, the money should be usable for the deposit helping people get on the housing ladder!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.itv.com/news/2016-08-20/help-to-buy-isa-scandal-leaves-500-000-first-time-buyers-unable-to-use-scheme-for-deposits/

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/08/19/help-to-buy-isa-scandal-500000-first-time-buyers-told-scheme-can/

attributes.action: Award QTS as part of EYITT
attributes.background: EYITT's have to meet the same entry requirements and the same set of rigorous standards as their counterparts who achieve QTS.
attributes.additional_details:
Without QTS, EYT's have found that they do not receive equal stature, pay or recognition for the demanding work that they carry out and their dedication, passion and commitment towards the teaching profession and children and families aged 0-5.

http://www.nurseryworld.co.uk/nursery-world/news/1159248/early-years-pay-and-conditions-survey-2016

https://getintoteaching.education.gov.uk/eligibility-for-teacher-training

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for politicians to lie to the public.
attributes.background: We cannot call ourselves a functioning democracy if our democratic decisions are taken based on lies and deceptions. We therefore demand that any politician who lies to or misleads the public be held legally accountable, and a new agency be set up to monitor political advertising and promotion.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that any politician who lies for personal or political gain should: 
1/ Be removed from their position
2/ Be banned from all public offices for a minimum of ten years
3/ Pay a fine based on the severity of the crime and their ability to pay
Any legislation enacted based on the lie must to be cancelled.
An independent body must be set up to monitor politicians to this effect, and also to monitor political advertising and campaign materials, similarly to the Advertising Standards Agency.

attributes.action: Include ADHD in the Disability Living Allowance SMI Criteria.
attributes.background: Make ADHD automatically an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain for Disability Living Allowance (Severe Mental Impairement Rules). Autism Spectrum Disorder is now automatically accepted as an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain, and ADHD should be too.
attributes.additional_details: ADHD comes little danger awareness and it is extremely hard to bring up a child who does not understand anything about danger, this means they need more help when out and about. To pass the severe mental impairment part of DLA you need to have an arrested or incomplete physical development of the brain. ADHD is exactly that however, it is not automatically classed as that. I feel like this condition is too overlooked and we are still stuck in the dark ages regarding our views on it.

attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bhhivquadq7ycnd/AAAIl8mVW9GCiOyGwk71At_ra?dl=0

attributes.action: Call for No Confidence in PM Theresa May
attributes.background: Theresa May was appointed as PM of the UK when David Cameron stepped down. The public did not vote for her and she does not speak for the majority of the British Public.
attributes.additional_details:
After her short time in office May has already managed to enrage most of the British Public. 
We voted her party to speak on behalf of us in parliament but she doesn't seem interested by our worries or voices. It's time someone else spoke for us.

attributes.action: To create awareness and delvelop treatment on Temporomandibular Joint disorders
attributes.background:
The symptoms of TMJD include facial pain, reduced mouth opening and headaches which can be very debilitating. 

PURPOSE: 
- patients need to know which treatments they can access 
- to create more TMJD centers on the NHS in all regions of the UK, not just London
- more research into TMJD.
attributes.additional_details: TMJD affects approx. 25% of the population. There are very few NHS clinics which provide TMJD treatment in the UK compared to the USA even though there are NICE Guidelines set out for TMJD, most patients who do not know that treatment is available.

attributes.action: Reduce the women's retirement age back to 60.
attributes.background: Women work hard within the workplace and having to work many extra hours at home.

attributes.action: Stop the disbandment of the British Army White Helmets Motorcycle Display Team.
attributes.background: They are a 30-strong display team from the Royal Corps of Signals and are being scrapped this year. They were Formed in the 1920s and have thrilled millions across the globe for decades with their daredevil displays – but the British Army is Axeing the White Helmets for being ‘out of date’.
attributes.additional_details:
The riders will be given new roles as recruiters by the end of the year, which has saddened many in the military. One White Helmets commander said: ‘It’s a great shame. 'Yet another piece of the Army’s heritage is being scrapped.’

Let's stop this madness - they are not out of date - they are a must for the British Army.!!!

attributes.action: Change the law. Make Civil & Family Judges accountable in law and to Parliament.
attributes.background: Most people do not know that currently Judges cannot be prosecuted for Judicial Acts. Most Judges are excellent, but some are not. This new law shall give us the people the right to challenge them. Only right in our modern society. Judges shall remain unelected yes, but accountable they must become.
attributes.additional_details:
This reform law shall make Judges accountable for Misconduct in Public Office if for example they fail to:

1 Disclose Conflicts of Interest with any person involved in a case they hear. 

2 Fail to inform the Police if they discover  evidence of crime in a Family or Civil case.

Secondly if a Civil Judge fails to adhere to, or enforce a Statute of Parliament, thus the will of Parliament, which is after all the will of the people, they can be brought to Parliament to face Contempt of Parliament

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd referendum which includes 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain.
attributes.background:
Did the EU referendum breach the
CHARTER OF FUNDAMENTAL RIGHTS OF THE EU
CH V: CITIZENS' RIGHTS Article 41
Right to good administration
2.     This right includes:
the right of every person to be heard, before any individual measure which would affect him or her adversely is taken;
attributes.additional_details:
The EU Referendum precluded over 2 million EU Nationals living in Britain from voting, the outcome of which will affect them adversely.
If we leave the EU it is likely EU Nationals will stay in Britain and will then have the right to vote in all elections, with a possibility of a coalition government with the SNP and Liberal Democrats calling for a referendum.
The vote to leave the EU has sent shock waves throughout Europe we have a chance to influence the EU and re-unite Europe.

attributes.action: Install an electric vehicle charging point in every town and village in the uk
attributes.background: There are vehicle charging points in London and the South and in towns and cities around Europe. If the government is promoting their use and therefore reduced emissions, it is vital that these are available throughout the UK. Charging points in every conurbation would allow for all electric travel.
attributes.additional_details: My parents, friends and I (and other advocates of the change to all electric vehicles) feel it is a shame that charging points are not available when we travel. We support this initiative but it is made a lot less practical because of the lack of charging points in accessible places. We recognise the government provides grants for their installation, however if every council was made to install them these would be redundant. Grants are about pro activity, laws are about consistency.

attributes.action: Make sports playing fields dog free areas - we need to protect our children.
attributes.background: I am a grassroots football coach and am becoming increasingly angered by the amount of time spent picking up dog faeces before training and matches. Talking to coaches from around the country this is a national problem. TIME TO BAN DOGS FROM ALL PLAYING FIELDS for the sake of our children.
attributes.additional_details:
My club in the East End of Newcastle have pushed hard to protect the kids, however the irresponsible dog owners appear at times that the wardens aren't around.
We have been highlighted in the Newcastle Evening Chronicle and some people have been fined but the practice of being ignorant by some people just doesn't stop.

attributes.action: Remove the tax on child support for victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
The 4 per cent Child Maintenance Service (CMS) collection fee presents real difficulties, particularly for domestic abuse victims.

For victims, a family-based arrangement is mostly impossible to arrange and using the CMS may be the only safe way for victims of domestic abuse to claim support.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling on the UK Government to protect, not punish victims of domestic violence by removing the 4% collection charge for victim-survivors.

More background information here:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/child-maintenance-service-single-mother-dwp-snp-child-support-agency-a7505746.html

http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/news/scottish-news/theresa-urged-abolish-cruel-domestic-9446041

http://www.eveningtimes.co.uk/news/14961377.Charge_is____cruel____tax_on_abuse_survivors/

attributes.action: To grant Reading (Berkshire) city status as a key hub in Thames Valley
attributes.background: Reading (Berkshire) has a population of 232,000 and is a key hub for the Thames Valley region.  Its importance should be recognised and given city status.  We the people of Reading are now asking the Lord Chancellor to recommend to the Monarch, the granting of city status to Reading.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading is a Vibrant City that contributes significantly to our economy and culture.  It is one of the largest towns worthy of City status.

The town applied in 2012 and was disappointed after a long application process.  It was not selected as one of the three cities chosen but we strongly believe that it should be chosen.

attributes.action: To keep the Four Freedoms as defined by membership of the EEA even after Brexit.
attributes.background: All those who voted Remain and many who voted Leave are in favour of the Four Freedoms and accept that this includes Free Movement of People. These voters are the true majority. Restricting European migration was NOT an option on the ballot paper and should not, therefore, be a Brexit "deal breaker"
attributes.additional_details: For example, many small businesses voted Leave in protest of excessive EU regulations. Many more individuals voted Leave because they believed it would help fund the NHS. Plenty voted Leave to give the UK sovereignty over its own Laws. Others voted in protest of the Tory policy of austerity. Only a MINORITY of the voters voted Leave to control migration. The Government should, therefore, keep the Four Freedoms in the Brexit negotiations as is the wish of the voting majority.

attributes.action: Prevent leaders of countries that ban entry of Israelis/Jews from coming to UK
attributes.background: Leaders of countries that ban the entry of Israelis or Jews should be allowed to enter the UK in their capacity as head of their Government, but should not be invited to make an official State Visit because it would cause embarrassment to Her Majesty the Queen.
attributes.additional_details:
You will be shocked that in the 21st century there are countries which ban entry to their borders based on religion!

Countries (including airlines) which ban Israelis/Jews from entering their borders include:  Algeria,Bangladesh,Brunei,Iran,Iraq,Kuwait, Lebanon,Libya,Malaysia,Oman,Pakistan,Saudi Arabia,Sudan,Syria, United Arab Emirates,Yemen

They are however free to enter Israel! 

The government should also pressurize these countries to reverse this disgraceful policies.

attributes.action: Give teachers the choice to retire at 55 with full retirement benefits.
attributes.background: Teachers can retire at the age of 55 but with reduced retirement benefits. The government should give teachers the choice to retire at the age of 55 with full retirement benefits (worked out by the number of years an individual has paid into their pension).
attributes.additional_details:
More teachers would choose to retire early and therefore could be replaced with newly qualified teachers. The benefits would be:
* Mature teachers who wish to retire early could do so without worrying about financial barriers.
* The teaching profession will be more appealing.
* If the teachers were to be replaced by newly qualified teachers, it would cost less.
* Happier schools with enthusiastic teachers who actually want to be there instead of having teachers who have no choice but to be there just because they can't afford to retire on the small fraction currently offered

attributes.action: Discuss the competency of Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.
attributes.background: The Alexandra Hospital in Redditch is slowly being downgraded by the Worcestershire Acute Hospitals NHS Trust.  Why?
attributes.additional_details:
The people of Redditch, Studley and Bromsgrove are affected because:
The public transport links from Redditch to Worcester are poor.
Maternity and Paedeatrics have already closed at Redditch.
The consultants are leaving the Alexandra Hospital, so more wards are closing.
The parking at Worcester Royal Hospital is inadequate.
Worcester Royal Hospital cannot cope with more patients.

The government should launch an investigation into the Trusts finances and its actions to remove services from Redditch Alexandra in favour of Worcester Royal.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to make all strike action on the railways illegal.
attributes.background: The ongoing strike action by Southern Rail staff has caused misery for hundreds of thousands of commuters, in some cases leading to people losing their jobs. In 21st Century Britain this should not be allowed.  The rest of us have to go to work every day - why should they hold the UK to ransom?
attributes.additional_details: I take Southern trains back from work every day.  They have been either late or cancelled about 95% of the time over the last year.
